newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - Washington Post page one - Sept 27.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Washington Post page one - Sept 27.

text.p: The Washington Post carried the following stories on its front page on Sept. 27:
RAMALLAH, West Bank - At least 35 Palestinians and 11 Israelis died in the broadest eruption of violence in the West Bank and Gaza Strip since Israel conquered the territories in 1967.

AL-BIREH, West Bank - Palestinian marchers defy Israelis with stones and anger, egging on comrades in the police force to use their assault rifles against Israelis who ostensibly were their partners in peace.
WASHINGTON - A genetic mutation common in U.S. whites slows the progression of AIDS in people infected with the AIDS-causing virus, according to a new study.

WASHINGTON - The House Ethics Subcommittee investigating Speaker Newt Gingrich voted unanimously to expand its probe to examine whether the speaker provided accurate, reliable and complete information to the panel.
WASHINGTON - The capital's crumbling Woodrow Wilson Bridge should be replaced by a 12-lane, $1.5 billion drawbridge, a regional panel concluded.

WASHINGTON - A drug ring posing as a church group smuggled cocaine and prostitutes into the Lorton Correctional Complex and filmed a pornographic video in the prison chapel, officials said in announcing 30 arrests.
WASHINGTON - Household income rose for the first time in six years while the proportion of Americans living below the poverty line fell last year, the Census Bureau reported.
